intro: Memora obtusifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leaved memora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with rounded lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, smooth, yellowish fruits. Memora obtusifoliolata is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
